Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HP 2-20 (HP (2-20); Hp(2-20), Lys-rich; cecropin-like, natural AMPs-like, bacteria, prokaryotes)
Sequence Information.Source: a fragment of the amino-terminal part of ribosomal protein L1 inHelicobacter pylori

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: the sequence is identical to that of the amino-terminal part of ribosomal protein L1 in H. pylori.Activity: active against Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 3.12 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 3.12 uM), S. aureus (MIC 12.5 uM), Gram- E. coli (MIC 12.5 uM), P. vulgaris (MIC 6.25 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 12.5 uM).Fungi: active against C. albicans (MIC 12.5-25 uM), T. beigelii (MIC 6.25-25 um), and S. cerevisiae (MIC 12.5-25 uM) at 28oC and 37oC (Jang et al., 2004.It has a nematocidal  activity against eggs and worms of C. elegans.chemotactic for neutrophils.In vitro toxicity: not hemo.lytic up to 100 uM.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure bound to SDS micellesherein the PDB. Updated 2/2014; 6/2019; Jan2024.
Literature Information.Author: Bylund J, Christophe T, Boulay F, Nystr√∂m T, Karlsson A, Dahlgren C. 2001
Literature Information.Title: Proinflammatory activity of a cecropin-like antibacterial peptide from Helicobacter pylori.
